business.headline: Explained: Why Senco Gold shares crashed 20% after Q3 results Senco Gold share price: In the third quarter, Senco Gold reported a nearly 70% drop in consolidated net profit to Rs 33 crore, compared to Rs 109 crore in the same period last year.

JioCinema, Disney+ Hotstar merge to launch JioHotstar: What it means for youReliance Industries and Walt Disney's India business finalised their merger in November 2024, creating a joint venture with Viacom18 Media.
Sensex, Nifty gain as US-India trade talks show positive signsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 86.75 points to 76,225.72, while the NSE Nifty50 added 12.50 points to 23,043.90 as of 9:46 AM.
Nasdaq rises over 1% on inflation relief; Tesla soars 6%, Nvidia up 4%The Nasdaq Composite jumped 1.5%, the S&P 500 gained 1.04%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.77%

New Income Tax bill explained: What's changing and what's notNew Income Tax bill: It aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act, 1961, by making it more structured and easier to understand. If passed, the new law will come into effect from April 1, 2026.

EPFO likely to maintain 8.25% interest rate on PF deposits EPFO interest rate: In 2024-25, EPFO processed over 50.8 million claims worth Rs 2.05 lakh crore when compared to 44.5 million claims amounting to Rs 1.82 lakh crore settled in the previous year, as per the official data.

Adani Green Energy exits Sri Lanka wind power deal; stock down 1%Adani Green Energy shares: As per the agreement with Sri Lanka, Adani Green was to construct two wind power projects in Mannar town and Pooneryn village, both located in the northern province of the country.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to end lower as IT stocks weigh in on stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 32.11 points to close at 76,138.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.85 points to end at 23,031.40.

Finance Minister Nirmala SItharaman introduces new Income Tax Bill in Lok SabhaFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the new Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha amid the huge uproar by the opposition MPs. The bill will now be referred to the Select Committee of Lok Sabha for further review.
New Income Tax Bill tabled in Lok Sabha, faces select panel reviewThe government, in a bid to simplify the present Income Tax Act, 1961, has introduced a new income tax bill in Parliament today.

Explained: Why are large-cap mutual funds back in demandWith small-cap and mid-cap stocks experiencing corrections, investors are moving towards large-cap funds, which are considered safer and more stable in volatile times.

Quality Power IPO: 10 things investors must know before subscribing Quality Power Electrical Equipments Limited offers high-voltage electrical equipment and solutions for grid connectivity and energy transition.

entertainment.headline: Mrs director Arati Kadav on backlash over missing credits: Glad it was called outDirector Arati Kadav addresses the backlash over Mrs not crediting The Great Indian Kitchen in the trailer, stressing the need for proper recognition. Mrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, is streaming on Zee5.

Viral video: Kanan Gill made same remark as Ranveer Allahbadia years agoAs Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his India's Got Latent remark, an old video of Kanan Gill asking the same question resurfaces on the internet.

Kanye West, Bianca Censori heading for divorce? Team clarifiesIt was previously reported that singer-rapper Kanye West and his wife, Bianca Censori, had split and were headed for divorce. However, a recent development has refuted these claims, labelling them as "tabloid rumours."

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs. makes questions on marital rape, mechanical sex personalImagine a woman bleeding for five days in a month, and those five days being the most peaceful in her life because she can finally refuse sex to her husband. He can't assert his power over her. That's how Sanya Malhotra's 'Mrs.' unsettles you and makes you think.

Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani meets with an accident, undergoes treatmentVishal Dadlani of the Vishal-Sheykhar duo is undergoing treatment after an accident, leading to the postponement of their upcoming concert scheduled for March 2.

Not just Gujarat, all Samay Raina shows cancelled amid India's Got Latent rowSamay Raina's shows in India have been cancelled following controversy around India's Got Latent, with Gujarat shows being the first to be affected.

Singer Jonita Gandhi to perform at Lollapalooza India, will open for Shawn MendesJonita Gandhi will perform at Lollapalooza India on March 8, opening for Shawn Mendes. Her latest single Channa has also been nominated for a Juno Award.

Twilight star Taylor Lautner to return as werewolf in self-aware werewolf seriesTwilight star Taylor Lautner is returning to portray a werewolf in the self-aware Amazon series. Details of the show are yet to be revealed.

Anupamaa actor Rupali Ganguly seeks blessings at Maha KumbhActor Rupali Ganguly visited Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj with her family. She shared moments from her spiritual visit, including performing aarti, attending a hawan, and meeting a saint.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui begins Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in LucknowActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has begun Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in Lucknow. The actor will be seen sharing screen space with Chitragandha Singh.

Olivia Swann on NCIS: Sydney, her character's growth & challenges In this exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Olivia Swann dives deep into her role in NCIS: Sydney, sharing insights into her character's journey, development, and challenges throughout the series.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

general news.headline: Modi gets lot of tareef, India gets loads of tariffs from Trump on key US visitModi-Trump meet: A warm hug was followed by a firm handshake as PM Modi entered the White House, but the chill was palpable following the US President's announcement of sweeping reciprocal tariffs.

26/11 plotter extradition, F-35 jets, trade deal: Takeaways from Modi-Trump meetModi-Trump meet: The key takeaways from the Modi-Trump meeting were the extradition of 26/11 Mumbai terror attack accused Tahawwur Rana to India and the F-35 jet deal.

Trump's offer of F-35 to India: A game-changer for air superiority?The Donald Trump administration has offered to supply India with the F-35 Lightning II fighter jet, a fifth-generation stealth fighter renowned for its ability to operate undetected at supersonic speeds.

Supreme Court declines urgent hearing to Ranveer Allahbadia over FIRs in joke rowYouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia approached the Supreme Court against multiple FIRs filed against him over an obscene joke on the reality show 'India's Got Latent.'

Flattery and friction: How foreign media reported PM Modi's meeting with TrumpPrime Minister Narendra Modi's meeting with US President Donald Trump garnered significant attention from global media, with many outlets making note of the friction between the two sides over trade and tariffs.

PM steers clear of Adani question, Rahul Gandhi takes 'personal matter' jabModi-Trump meet: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, when asked about the US indictment of Gautam Adani, said such 'personal matters' were not discussed during his meeting with Trump.

Trump's special gift for 'friend' Modi, signs it 'Mr Prime Minister, you are great'Trump gifted PM Modi a signed copy of 'Our Journey Together', a photobook chronicling his first term in the White House. He personally signed the book, inscribing: "Mr Prime Minister, you are great."

Trump praises PM Modi: Not a contest, he's a tougher, better negotiator than mePrime Minister Narendra Modi and Trump engaged in bilateral talks, focusing on key issues such as trade, defence, and immigration. During the joint press briefing, the US President praised PM Modi's negotiating skills.

Chhaava review: Vicky Kaushal's film growls, but doesn't roarReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Chhaava movie review: Director Laxman Utekar's Chhaava, starring Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna, is based on the life of Maratha King Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj. Brilliant Vicky Kaushal uplifts this strenuous film, says our review.

JioHotstar is now live in India, merges content from Jiocinema and Disney HotstarJioHotstar has recently launched in India. Users can now watch content from both Jiocinema and Disney+ Hotstar in one app.

MAGA + MIGA = MEGA partnership, says PM Modi as India, US vow to boost tradePrime Minister Narendra Modi, during his official two-day visit to the US, said that India is moving towards MIGA (Make India Great Again), which is his version of MAGA (Make America Great Again).

Trump clears 26/11 plotter Tahawwur Rana's extradition: Giving violent man backUS President Donald Trump announced the approval of 26/11 Mumbai terror attack convict Tahawwur Rana's extradition to India, stating he will face justice.

Captain America Brave New World review: Roger that, Sam's Caps never fully soarReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Captain America Brave New World movie review: Director Julius Onah's film starring Anthony Mackie and Danny Ramirez, is an uneven addition to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The performances are good, but the film lacks identity.

Are red aloe vera products a scam?Aloe sanguinalis, also known as Somali red aloe or 'red aloe vera' gel, is gaining attention as a better alternative to aloe vera gel. However, experts seem to disagree.

$1,000 fine for men ejaculating without intent to conceive under new Ohio billThe two lawmakers who proposed the bill "The Conception Begins at Erection Act" said the aim is to "call out the hypocrisy" of "bills that regulate women's bodies."

Trump says US to make wonderful deals for India, PM talks of $500 billion targetUS President Donald Trump welcomed Prime Minister Modi to the White House hours after he announced reciprocal tariffs that levies tariffs on US imports.

Viral video: Kanan Gill made same remark as Ranveer Allahbadia years agoAs Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his India's Got Latent remark, an old video of Kanan Gill asking the same question resurfaces on the internet.

Kohli gifts signed India jersey to Pietersen's son: Fits like a gloveVirat Kohli gifted a signed India jersey to Kevin Pietersen's son, Dylan, prompting a heartfelt Instagram post from the former England captain, who expressed gratitude for the special gesture.

Mahindra BE 6, XEV 9e bookings open, here are detailsMahindra has officially commenced the bookings of its born electric vehicles (BEVs), the BE 6 and the XEV 9e. Customer deliveries of these BEVs are set to begin in mid-March.

Trump declares reciprocal tariffs: Whatever countries charge US, we charge themDonald Trump announced reciprocal tariffs, vowing to match duties imposed on American goods. The policy, which he said was aimed at fairness, could take effect within weeks, impacting global trade, including high tariff rates for India.

He can't assert his power over her. That's how Sanya Malhotra's 'Mrs.' unsettles you and makes you think.

Kerala's Rs 1,000-crore half-price scam: Victims explain how they got dupedIn one of the biggest scams in Kerala, a 26-year-old graduate duped 40,000 people across the state with a Ponzi-style network, offering scooters, mobiles, laptops and other household items at half their price. This is how Ananthu Krishnan pulled off the state-wide Rs 1,000-crore scam.

Laila X review: Internet declares Vishwak Sen's film 'disaster', calls it 'torture'Vishwak Sen's Telugu film Laila hit theatres on Valentine's Day. The audience's verdict is in, and based on reactions on X, the film failed to strike a chord with viewers, with many calling it a disaster.

India to take back verified illegals: PM Modi amid US crackdown on immigrantsPM Modi assured the United States that India is ready to take back verified illegals as Donald Trump launched a crackdown on undocumented immigrants in America.

The Diplomat trailer: John Abraham on a deadly mission to save 'Daughter of India'The Diplomat trailer starring John Abraham in the lead was released on February 14. The trailer highlights the efforts of Indian diplomat JP Singh in bringing India's daughter back home.

Vicky Kaushal's parents, Sharvari Wagh, and others at Chhaava screeningA special screening of Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava was hosted on February 13. The star-studded affair was also attended by his family, including his wife Katrina Kaif, parents, and brother Sunny Kaushal.
Richa Chadha announces Akhri Somvaar, a dramedy she wrote and stars inActor Richa Chadha announced her next project, Akhri Somvaar. Chadha has written and will also star in the upcoming dramedy.

Thunderbolts: Who is The Sentry, the film's supposed supervillain?Marvel's Thunderbolts is set to introduce The Sentry, a character known for his dual nature as both hero and villain. Lewis Pullman will be seen playing the complex role and fans cannot wait.

sports.headline: Mbappe returns to France squad for Nations League quarter-final: DeschampsDidier Deschamps confirmed Kylian Mbappe's return to the France squad for the Nations League quarterfinal against Croatia after the Real Madrid star rediscovered his form following a slow start to life in Spain.

Maxwell, Head return as Australia makes major changes in final ODI vs Sri LankaSL vs AUS: Australia made a total of 5 changes for the final ODI match vs Sri Lanka. Australia brought in the heavy hitters before the Champions Trophy.

IPL teams' involvement will not affect Pakistan players in Hundred: GouldIndian Premier League's involvement in the Hundred would not affect the participation of Pakistani players in the tournament, said ECB chief executive Richard Gould. 4 IPL teams recently bought stakes in the competition.

Calvin Kattar aiming to finish 'unfinished business' in UFC featherweightAfter a few years of struggle, Calvin Kattar is ready to get back to the top of the featherweight division in the UFC. In an exclusive interaction with Indiatoday.in, the Boston Finisher opens up about his aims for 2025, his unfinished business at featherweight and what he expects to do in the fight against Youssef Zalal.

PAK vs NZ, final: Pakistan eye tri-series title in Champions Trophy tune-upODI tri-series final: Pakistan aim to test themselves against a well-drilled New Zealand side in Friday's final in Karachi. The two teams will face off at the same venue in their Champions Trophy opener next week.

Watch: Schwartzman fights tears as home crowd bids emotional farewellDiego Schwartzman received an emotional farewell in Buenos Aires as fans chanted his name before his final career point, marking the end of an inspiring journey in professional tennis.

Rachin Ravindra few more steps away from being fit: New Zealand coach SteadNew Zealand head coach Gary Stead confirmed that Rachin Ravindra is still recovering from his facial injury, raising concerns over his availability for the Champions Trophy opener against Pakistan on February 19.

Champions Trophy 2025: Can Steve Smith guide depleted Australia to title glory?Australia are always considered favourites heading into ICC events, but things seem to be a little different this time. The Aussies will look for inspiration from Steve Smith and a bit of magic from their remaining ODI World Cup heroes to win the Champions Trophy for the first time since 2009.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
